tournament.name: Westboro Magic League - Aether Revolt Season Finals

decks.notes: This deck focuses on control, utilizing Breya, Etherium Shaper as the commander. The main strategy revolves around disrupting opponents and gaining card advantage. The deck includes a variety of artifact mana sources such as Mox Opal and Chrome Mox to accelerate mana development. It also features powerful control cards like Swords to Plowshares, Path to Exile, Remand, and Negate. Additionally, the deck incorporates artifact synergies with cards like Thopter Foundry, Sword of the Meek, and Mycosynth Wellspring. The deck aims to control the game through disruptive spells and efficient removal, while creating a strong board presence with artifacts and token generation.

The deck focuses on consistent mana fixing and ramp to play powerful threats and maintain control of the game. It includes a mix of planeswalkers, creatures with value-generating abilities, and efficient removal spells. The commander, Atraxa, Praetors' Voice, serves as a versatile threat that can support the strategy by proliferating counters on permanents. The deck aims to control the board through removal and incremental advantage, utilizing card advantage engines like Phyrexian Arena and Mirri's Guile to outvalue the opponent. It also has a subtheme of lifegain and incremental life advantage with cards like Thragtusk, Archangel of Thune, and Kitchen Finks to stabilize and outlast aggressive strategies.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies by utilizing a combination of efficient creatures, removal spells, and combat tricks to put pressure on the opponent quickly and consistently. With Bruse Tarl, Boorish Herder as the commander, the deck aims to deal damage efficiently and effectively while disrupting the opponent's game plan with a mix of hand disruption and removal spells. The creature selection ranges from powerful beaters like Tarmogoyf and Siege Rhino to utility creatures like Mother of Runes and Scavenging Ooze. The deck also includes a diverse array of lands to support the mana requirements of the multicolored spells and provide additional utility through abilities like lifegain and creature pumping.

The deck revolves around controlling the game by utilizing counter spells, removal, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. Grand Arbiter Augustin IV serves as the commander to help decrease the cost of spells and tax the opponent's spells, slowing down their game plan. The deck includes various control elements such as Supreme Verdict, Force of Will, and Cryptic Command to handle threats efficiently. Card advantage is gained through cards like Sphinx's Revelation and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Win conditions include creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Dragonlord Ojutai, as well as planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion. Overall, the deck aims to control the board, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and win through incremental advantage.

The Brimaz, King of Oreskos deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with an aggressive strategy using powerful white creatures like Baneslayer Angel, Thalia, Heretic Cathar, and Gisela, the Broken Blade. The deck includes cards that provide additional value or protection for these creatures, such as Steelshaper's Gift, Sword of Fire and Ice, and Hero of Bladehold. It also features removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Wrath of God to deal with threats from the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent, using Brimaz as a versatile commander to lead the charge into battle and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Kambal, Consul of Allocation as the commander to apply pressure on the opponent through a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The strategy involves controlling the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Toxic Deluge, while also taxing the opponent through cards like Authority of the Consuls and Kambal's ability. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Vampire Nighthawk and Wurmcoil Engine to maintain board presence and drain the opponent's life total. With a combination of aggressive threats and disruptive elements, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and close out the game efficiently in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

Utilizing a combination of efficient control spells, Narset, Enlightened Master aims to delay and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for powerful combo turns. With a mix of counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt, and versatile card draw engine of Fact or Fiction and Narset Transcendent, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing Narset's ability to cast spells for free off the top of the library, the deck can chain together multiple extra turn spells like Time Warp and Temporal Manipulation to quickly close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's triple-color casting cost spells.

The deck revolves around utilizing The Gitrog Monster's ability to draw cards whenever a land is put into the graveyard from the battlefield. By combining cards that allow for land recursion, such as Life from the Loam and Splendid Reclamation, with land-based ramp and ramp spells like Cultivate and Kodama's Reach, the deck aims to quickly ramp up and control the board. Additionally, there are combo pieces such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage for a potential win condition. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push to control the opponent's board state. Ultimately, the deck focuses on land synergy and resource management to outmaneuver and outpace opponents in a Duel Commander format.
